bill_title: require that certain conditions be met before a building permit is issued.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require that certain conditions be met before a building permit is issued. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. No building permit may be issued unless the person seeking the permit certifies in writing to the issuing authority that the contractor has liability insurance and a performance bond in the sum equal to the contract price, conditioned that the contractor will execute the contract. The bond shall be issued by a surety company authorized to do business in the state. An issuing authority may deny a building permit for past bad faith performance. 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
